how would you describe your main use cas: Note-taking;As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content)
do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: No, but I may export content into other formats and share individual tiddlers, the whole wiki, or an extract of the wiki
what is your level of ability with tiddl: I have customised TiddlyWiki through options and plugins;I am comfortable using WikiText widgets (e.g. <$transclude>, <$list>...);I am comfortable writing filter expressions
how do you save changes in tiddlywiki?: Single-file wiki through web browser with Download Saver (default saving mechanism);Single-file wiki third-party mobile app (e.g. Tiddloid, Quine)
how do you back up/sync changes between: No automatic sync across my devices

what are we doing well? prompts for thin:
Keeping it still within the browser as a simple html file.
Sensible approach, ie. keep the base as simple as possible, ie. not screwing it with too many features.
Communication via newsletter (neither too often nor not enough) - it is just right.
Maintain a wide community.
what could we do better? prompts for thi:
Despite reading many tips and guides in the community wikis, I often as a non developer struggle to understand majority of advices. Usually I am capable of reusing only the code that includes the example. - Just the text description simply does not work for me. Typical bad example:
Transcluding Text References, You can also use a TextReference instead of a tiddler title:
{{MyTiddler##index}} transcludes a specified indexed property of a DataTiddler
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
